etymologies: early 16th century: from Latin, variant of spathula, diminutive of spatha (see spathe)

definitions: an implement with a broad, flat, blunt blade, used for mixing and spreading things, especially in cooking and painting.
shortDefinitions: implement with broad, flat, blunt blade, used for mixing and spreading things

definitions: a kitchen utensil with a broad flat blade for lifting and turning food.
shortDefinitions: kitchen utensil with a broad flat blade

definitions: a thin, flat wooden or metal instrument used in medical examinations, for holding down the tongue or taking cell samples.
shortDefinitions: thin, flat wooden or metal instrument used in medical examinations
